thread.title: Maldives Vice President Ahmed Adeeb held for plotting murder of President Yameen Abdul Gayoom
thread.title_full: Maldives Vice President Ahmed Adeeb held for plotting murder of President Yameen Abdul Gayoom

author: Saurav Mukherjee
title: Maldives Vice President Ahmed Adeeb held for plotting murder of President Yameen Abdul Gayoom
text:
Maldives Vice President Ahmed Adeeb held for plotting murder of President Yameen Abdul Gayoom By Saurav Mukherjee on October 24, 2015 at 2:10 PM Comments 
Male (Maldives), October 24: The Home Minister of Maldives Umar Naseer made a shocking announcement on Saturday by saying that the state autrhorities have arrested Vice President Ahmed Adeeb over the allegation of plotting the assassination of President Yameen Abdul Gayoom, who luckily escaped death after his boat was hit was by a bomb blast last month. 
Announcing the arrest of the state vice chief, Umar Naseer tweeted, ”VP Adeeb under arrest and held in Dhoonidhoo Detention (prison island)”, followed by another tweet, “Charges: high treason.” As per to the latest report the police have arrested Ahmed Adeeb over the suspicion of links to a blast in which the President survived a blast while he was travelling in a boat. According to police spokesman Ismail Ali, Adeeb was arrested on Saturday at the airport when he returned from an official visit to China. (ALSO READ: India, Maldives to step up cooperation in defence, security ) 
The Maldivian President Gayoom’ boat was attacked on September 28 with and explosion which took place aboard the boat when he was returning with his wife to the capital from the airport after a hajj pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia. The president had to take the boat as the airport of this island country is situated on a a separate island. In the incident, Gayooom escaped unhurt but his wife, an aide and a bodyguard were injured. 
  2:24 PM Topics:
